name: Physical Literacy
description: Fundamental movement skills that form the foundation of all athletic development. Includes running, jumping, throwing, catching, kicking, and striking. Based on the ABCs of athleticism: Agility, Balance, Coordination, and Speed. Source: NSCA Youth Training Guidelines

name: Technical Skills
description: Sport-specific techniques and motor patterns unique to each discipline. Proper mechanics, form, and execution of sport movements. Developed through deliberate practice and expert coaching. Source: USA Sport National Governing Bodies

name: Tactical Understanding
description: Game sense, decision-making, and strategic awareness. Understanding of offensive and defensive concepts, positioning, and reading the game. Develops through game play and guided discovery. Source: US Soccer Player Development Model

name: Mental Performance
description: Psychological skills essential for athletic success including confidence, focus, resilience, motivation, and competitive mindset. Includes goal setting, visualization, self-talk, and pressure management. Source: AAP Sports Psychology Guidelines

name: Nutrition & Recovery
description: Fueling performance through proper nutrition, hydration, sleep, and recovery protocols. Age-appropriate guidance on pre/post workout nutrition, hydration strategies, and rest requirements. Source: AAP Nutrition Guidelines for Young Athletes

name: Injury Prevention
description: Safe training practices including proper warm-up, mobility work, strength balance, and recognizing warning signs. Understanding of overuse injury prevention and the importance of rest. Source: AAP Overuse Injuries Position Statement
